It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and they bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Mollinedia hylophila is adapted to cold, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests and alpine meadows.
